post_text:
Students will be better able to approach the school year feeling prepared, excited and ready to learn with a bit of planning and calm guidance on your part.
-
Below Are 5 Tips to help get you started:
-
1. Discuss what your children can expect on the first day of school so they feel more prepared.
2. Let children choose a planner or scheduling tool they're excited to use.
3. Set your children' sleep schedules back to "school time" two weeks before the first day of school.
4. Talk openly with your children about their feelings about returning to school and be ready to answer any questions.
5. Teach children to prioritize their assignments by making to-do lists with deadlines.
